channel.title: INtech
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtech, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: AI Videos of Black Women Depicted as ‘Bigfoot’ Are Going Viral
item.description: Some Instagram creators are using Google’s Veo 3 and racking up millions of views on AI videos of “bigfoot baddies.” They’ll teach you how to make the...

item.title: Trump’s New Fragrance Doesn’t Smell Like Success
item.description: Early reviews are in for the US president's “rallying cry in a bottle”—and they’re not good. It also costs $249.

item.title: Sam Altman Slams Meta’s AI Talent Poaching Spree: 'Missionaries Will Beat Mercenaries'
item.description: “What Meta is doing will, in my opinion, lead to very deep cultural problems,” said OpenAI CEO Sam Altman in a leaked memo sent to OpenAI researchers.

item.title: The Senate Just Put Clean Energy for AI in the Crosshairs
item.description: President Donald Trump’s budget would kill off tax credits for wind and solar, raising costs for new clean energy projects and blowing up valuable inv...

item.title: Nothing releases their first over-the-ear headphones
item.description: Nothing has revealed its first over-the-ear headphones. The aluminum and transparent Headphone (1) was designed in collaboration with KEF. They offer ...

item.title: The electric Hummer is almost outselling the F-150 Lightning
item.description: GM's EVs were popular in the second quarter, a complete contrast to the struggles by Ford, Tesla, Hyundai, and Kia to grow electric vehicle sales.

item.title: Best iPad apps to boost productivity and make your life easier
item.description: There are many iPad apps to help you organize recipes; sync tasks across devices; be more productive; and manage your notes.

item.title: Nothing releases its first over-the-ear headphones, the $299 Headphone (1)
item.description: London-based smartphone maker Nothing has launched its first over-the-ear headphones, the Headphone (1). The new device follows Nothing’s first step i...

item.title: Nothing launches its most expensive flagship yet, Phone (3)
item.description: Nothing launched its newest flagship phone after a two-year gap. At an event in London, the company unveiled the Phone (3), which starts at $799 and a...

item.title: Nothing's New Phone (3) and Headphone (1) Look Nothing Like You've Seen Before
item.description: The unusual LED lights from the original Nothing phones have morphed into a matrix display that can show the time, a Magic 8 Ball, and even a spin-the...
